autoChirp.webController

Class GroupController

  • java.lang.Object
    • autoChirp.webController.GroupController

  • @Controller
 @RequestMapping(value="/groups")
public class GroupController
extends java.lang.Object
    A Spring MVC controller, responsible for serving /groups. This controller implements the logic to manage groups from the web-UI. It loosely implements all CRUD methods and is strongly tied to all template- views. Every method uses the injected HttpSession object to check for an active user account. If no account is found in the session, the user is redirected to a genuin error/login page.
    Author:
    Philip Schildkamp

    • Method Detail

      • viewGroups

        @RequestMapping(value="/view")
public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView viewGroups(@RequestParam(name="page",defaultValue="1")
                                                                                               int page)
        A HTTP GET request handler, responsible for serving /groups/view. This method provides the returned view with all groups, read from the database, chunking the results to support pagination.
        Parameters:
        page - Request param containing the page number, defaults to 1
        Returns:
        View containing the groups overview

      • viewGroup

        @RequestMapping(value="/view/{groupID}")
public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView viewGroup(@PathVariable
                                                                                                        int groupID,
                                                                                                        @RequestParam(name="page",defaultValue="1")
                                                                                                        int page)
        A HTTP GET request handler, responsible for serving /groups/view/$groupid. This method is called to view a single group and its Tweets in detail. It reads all relevant information from the database and displays it as a view. If no group with the requested ID is found, an error is displayed.
        Parameters:
        groupID - Path param containing an ID-reference to a group
        page - Request param containing the page (of Tweets), defaults to 1
        Returns:
        View containing details for one group and its Tweets

      • addGroup

        @RequestMapping(value="/add")
public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView addGroup()
        A HTTP GET request handler, responsible for serving /groups/add. This method returns a view containing the form to add a new, empty group.
        Returns:
        View containing the group-creation form

      • addGroupPost

        @RequestMapping(value="/add",
                method=POST)
public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView addGroupPost(@RequestParam(value="title")
                                                                                                                              java.lang.String title,
                                                                                                                              @RequestParam(value="description")
                                                                                                                              java.lang.String description)
        A HTTP POST request handler, responsible for serving /groups/add. This method gets POSTed as the group-creation form is submitted. All input- field values are passed as parameters and checked for validity. Upon success a new group is added to the database.
        Parameters:
        title - POST param bearing the referenced input-field value
        description - POST param bearing the referenced input-field value
        Returns:
        Redirect-view if successful, else error-view

      • importGroup

        @RequestMapping(value="/import/{importer}")
public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView importGroup(@PathVariable
                                                                                                             java.lang.String importer)
        A HTTP GET request handler, responsible for serving /groups/import/$importer. This method returns a view containing the form to import a group. Depending on the $importer path param, the view behaves differently; if an unknown importer-type is requested, an error is shown.
        Parameters:
        importer - Path param containing the importer-type
        Returns:
        View containing the group-import form

      • importTSVGroupPost

        @RequestMapping(value="/import/tsv-file",
                method=POST)
public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView importTSVGroupPost(@RequestParam(value="source")
                                                                                                                                                org.springframework.web.multipart.MultipartFile source,
                                                                                                                                                @RequestParam(value="title")
                                                                                                                                                java.lang.String title,
                                                                                                                                                @RequestParam(value="description")
                                                                                                                                                java.lang.String description,
                                                                                                                                                @RequestParam(value="delay")
                                                                                                                                                int delay)
        A HTTP POST request handler, responsible for serving /groups/import/tsv-file. This method gets POSTed as the tsv-import form is submitted. All input- field values are passed as parameters and checked for validity. The tsv-file itself is passed as MultipartFile and later transfered to a temporary file. This file is passed to the TweetFactory, which returns a parsed TweetGroup, which then is inserted to the database and shown to the user.
        Parameters:
        source - POST param bearing the tsv-MultipartFile
        title - POST param bearing the referenced input-field value
        description - POST param bearing the referenced input-field value
        delay - POST param bearing the referenced input-field value
        Returns:
        Redirect-view if successful, else error-view

      • importWikipediaGroupPost

        @RequestMapping(value="/import/wikipedia",
                method=POST)
public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView importWikipediaGroupPost(@RequestParam(value="source")
                                                                                                                                                       java.lang.String source,
                                                                                                                                                       @RequestParam(value="title")
                                                                                                                                                       java.lang.String title,
                                                                                                                                                       @RequestParam(value="prefix")
                                                                                                                                                       java.lang.String prefix,
                                                                                                                                                       @RequestParam(value="description")
                                                                                                                                                       java.lang.String description)
        A HTTP POST request handler, responsible for serving /groups/import/wikipedia This method gets POSTed as the Wikipdia-import form is submitted. All input-field values are passed as parameters and checked for validity. The URL of the Wikipedia-article is validated against a basic regex and then passed to the TweetFactory, along with an according WikipediaParser-object, which returns a parsed TweetGroup, which then is inserted to the database and shown to the user.
        Parameters:
        source - POST param bearing the Wikipedia-article URL
        title - POST param bearing the referenced input-field value
        prefix - POST param bearing the referenced input-field value
        description - POST param bearing the referenced input-field value
        Returns:
        Redirect-view if successful, else error-view

      • editGroup

        @RequestMapping(value="/edit/{groupID}")
public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView editGroup(@PathVariable
                                                                                                        int groupID)
        A HTTP GET request handler, responsible for serving /groups/edit/$groupid. This method is responsible to present the group-creation form with all values prefilled into the according input-field. As such the form is re-used to edit a already created group.
        Parameters:
        groupID - Path param containing an ID-reference to a group
        Returns:
        View containing the group-creation form with prefilled values

      • editGroupPost

        @RequestMapping(value="/edit/{groupID}",
                method=POST)
public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView editGroupPost(@PathVariable
                                                                                                                                          int groupID,
                                                                                                                                          @RequestParam(value="title")
                                                                                                                                          java.lang.String title,
                                                                                                                                          @RequestParam(value="description")
                                                                                                                                          java.lang.String description)
        A HTTP POST request handler, responsible for serving /groups/edit/$groupid. This method gets POSTed as the group-editing form is submitted. All input- field values are passed as parameters and checked for validity. Upon success the referenced group gets updated in the database or an error is shown.
        Parameters:
        groupID - Path param containing an ID-reference to a group
        title - POST param bearing the referenced input-field value
        description - POST param bearing the referenced input-field value
        Returns:
        Redirect-view if successful, else error-view

      • toggleGroup

        @RequestMapping(value="/toggle/{groupID}")
public java.lang.String toggleGroup(@PathVariable
                                                                                int groupID)
        A HTTP GET request handler, responsible for serving /groups/toggle/$groupid. This method provides a way to toggle the activation-state of the group, referenced by $groupid. If the group is enabled after the toggle, the TweetScheduler is called to schedule all Tweets in the (now enabled) group.
        Parameters:
        groupID - Path param containing an ID-reference to a group
        Returns:
        Redirect-view to the toggled group overview

      • deleteGroup

        @RequestMapping(value="/delete/{groupID}")
public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView deleteGroup(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                                                                                            @PathVariable
                                                                                                            int groupID)
        A HTTP GET request handler, responsible for serving /groups/delete/$groupid. This method presents the user with a confirmation dialog, before forwading to the actual deletion the the referenced group.
        Parameters:
        request - Autowired HttpServletRequest object, containing header-fields
        groupID - Path param containing an ID-reference to a group
        Returns:
        View containing confirmation dialog for the intended action

      • confirmedDeleteGroup

        @RequestMapping(value="/delete/{groupID}/confirm")
public java.lang.String confirmedDeleteGroup(@PathVariable
                                                                                                 int groupID,
                                                                                                 @RequestParam(name="referer",defaultValue="/groups/view")
                                                                                                 java.lang.String referer)
        A HTTP GET request handler, responsible for serving /groups/delete/$groupid/confirm. This method triggers the actual deletion the the referenced group and redirects to a referer, if applicable.
        Parameters:
        groupID - Path param containing an ID-reference to a group
        referer - Request param containing the referer to redirect to
        Returns:
        Redirect-view
